summary: Treasury's Troubled Asset Relief Program was originally authorized to spend $700 billion to help prevent the U.S. financial system's collapse in 2008. As of September 30, 2021, TARP had spent $443.4 billion. But after repayments, dividends, and more, the estimated lifetime cost of TARP programs will be $32.0 billion.
